info: Should we try to answer this? The query tells us the earliest year the database knows of that the course was offered, so the dialog system would theoretically be able to say "Since 2005." But the database doesn't necessarily contain the complete history of course offerings; I think it only goes back to about 2004.

sentence: How long has EECS 485 been offered for ?
sentence-with-vars: How long has department0 number0 been offered for ?
sql: SELECT SEMESTERalias0.YEAR FROM COURSE AS COURSEalias0 , COURSE_OFFERING AS COURSE_OFFERINGalias0 , SEMESTER AS SEMESTERalias0 WHERE COURSEalias0.COURSE_ID = COURSE_OFFERINGalias0.COURSE_ID AND COURSEalias0.DEPARTMENT = "EECS" AND COURSEalias0.NUMBER = 485 AND SEMESTERalias0.SEMESTER_ID = COURSE_OFFERINGalias0.SEMESTER ORDER BY SEMESTERalias0.YEAR ASC LIMIT 1 ;
sql-with-vars: SELECT SEMESTERalias0.YEAR FROM COURSE AS COURSEalias0 , COURSE_OFFERING AS COURSE_OFFERINGalias0 , SEMESTER AS SEMESTERalias0 WHERE COURSEalias0.COURSE_ID = COURSE_OFFERINGalias0.COURSE_ID AND COURSEalias0.DEPARTMENT = "department0" AND COURSEalias0.NUMBER = number0 AND SEMESTERalias0.SEMESTER_ID = COURSE_OFFERINGalias0.SEMESTER ORDER BY SEMESTERalias0.YEAR ASC LIMIT 1 ;
